title: Quiz 5: Special Procedures & Investigations
description: Diagnostic investigations including blood/urine analysis, dialysis procedures, CVP monitoring, and tracheotomy care.

questions.question: What is the normal range for serum Potassium?

richContent.content:
ElectrolyteNormal Range (mmol/L)
Sodium135 - 143
Potassium???

questions.hint: It is a small single-digit range.

questions.question: Hyperkalaemia greater than ___BLANK___ mmol/L is an indication for dialysis.
questions.explanation: Hyperkalaemia > 7mmol/L with fluid overload is a specific indication for dialysis.

questions.question: The normal Central Venous Pressure (CVP) range is ___BLANK___ cm of water.
questions.explanation: Normal CVP is 3 - 8 cm H2O (or 2 - 5 mm Hg).

questions.question: Which of the following are contraindications for performing an MRI? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Magnetic energy affects metals, making pacemakers and metallic implants absolute contraindications.

questions.question: Match the dialysis type to its description:
questions.explanation: PD uses the peritoneum; Haemodialysis uses an external machine with a synthetic membrane.

questions.question: Air passing through a tracheotomy tube does NOT need to be humidified because the trachea does it naturally.
questions.explanation: A tracheotomy bypasses the nasopharynx where humidification occurs, so air MUST be artificially humidified.
questions.hint: Does the tube bypass the nose?

questions.question: Order the steps for changing a tracheotomy tube:

items.text: Remove the old tube with left hand
Insert new tube with right hand

questions.question: What does a low CVP reading typically indicate?
questions.explanation: Low CVP means low pressure in central veins, indicating low blood volume (hypovolaemia).

questions.question: Ideally, what temperature should the dialysate be before introduction in Peritoneal Dialysis?
questions.explanation: Dialysate should be at body temperature (37Â°C) for comfort and to promote vasodilation.

questions.question: In the scenario of Peritoneal Dialysis, why is the drainage bag placed lower than the patient?

richContent.content: Scenario: Nurse Jane is setting up PD. She places the infusion bag above the patient and the drainage bag on the floor.

questions.explanation: Gravity aids the drainage of fluid from the peritoneal cavity.
